185977502.review:
"𝘕𝘰 𝘰𝘯𝘦 𝘭𝘪𝘷𝘦𝘴 𝘪𝘯 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘴𝘭𝘶𝘮𝘴 𝘣𝘦𝘤𝘢𝘶𝘴𝘦 𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘺 𝘸𝘢𝘯𝘵 𝘵𝘰. 𝘐𝘵'𝘴 𝘭𝘪𝘬𝘦 𝘵𝘩𝘪𝘴 𝘵𝘳𝘢𝘪𝘯. 𝘐𝘵 𝘤𝘢𝘯 𝘰𝘯𝘭𝘺 𝘨𝘰 𝘸𝘩𝘦𝘳𝘦 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘵𝘳𝘢𝘤𝘬𝘴 𝘵𝘢𝘬𝘦 𝘪𝘵."

Essa atmosfera dieselpunk é extremamente envolvente e possui visuais intensos, além de contar com muitos mapas diferenciados que renovam o interesse enquanto você joga.

Primeiro Final Fantasy que joguei e zerei, fiquei surpreendido com a qualidade e tamanho do jogo para 1997. Adorei tanto a batalha em turnos que despertou meu interesse para jogar jogos nesse estilo, também os outros da franquia FF, mesmo não sendo fã do bate e espera.

Existe uma variedade gigantesca de skills/summons/builds e também diversas armas e items, o que não deixa a gameplay ficar monótona. São vários personagens jogáveis, todos bem trabalhados e com backstory interessante. O trio inicial foi minha party durante todo o jogo (usei a Aeris até certa parte).

A história é magnífica, sendo o ponto mais forte. A trama é envolvente e apresenta grandes reviravoltas, consegue ser imprevisível e muito criativa. Essa ambientação, também a desigualdade e guerra política no meio do enredo nutre muito a curiosidade do jogador para saber o desfecho. O antagonista é realmente incrível. Esse final do jogo é excelente e marcante, com bossfights extravagantes.

Não demonstrou partes negativas.

nota 🐤/10

Tempo de jogo: ≈40
Joguei na steam , usei bastante mods com o 7th Heaven.

This game suddenly requires linking to the Square-Enix account. Linking to another account is fine but not when Square-Enix's website cannot be reached and cannot detect my functioning internet connection. Steam support cannot handle, I spent half a day searching for  solutions and ways to reach Square-Enix support site only to find the sites are MIA and unreachable. And I can't play the game because of this EXTRA step. And it's not just FF7, I can't play my FF8-13 also because of this EXTRA step. This is ridiculous. Square-Enix already screwed me once with the mobile versions FF1-FF6 by doing a pixle remake and making the old versions of my FF1-FF6 only playable on the last device that had the game installed. And now that device has broke down after nearly a decade of wear and tear. Now, if I want to play FF1-FF6, I have buy them all over again. If Square-Enix enjoy making their games so inaccessible and do things that waste customers' money, fine. I will never purchase anything developed by Square-Enix again! I should have known that Square-Enix has become a cash grab developer when they made games like FFBE, Mobius FF etc. It was foolish of me to think that this attitude of Square Enix's won't affect single purchase games.

Conclusion: Square Enix is also corrupted to the core now, just like Activison and EA. From what I understood, this EXTRA step of needing internet access to play SINGLE PLAYER,/SINGLE PURCHASE game was to prevent piracy. So Square Enix is protecting their own interest by sacrificing players'. Stay away from from all of Square Enix's products as you would with EA and Activision.

185493376.review:
A Timeless RPG Classic!
Final Fantasy VII is a masterpiece that revolutionized the RPG genre and remains one of the most beloved games of all time. 
The game’s story is a blend of action, drama, and deep emotional moments. 
Themes of identity, loss, and friendship are explored with great depth, making the characters feel real and relatable. 
Cloud, Tifa, Aerith, and Barret become unforgettable companions, and their personal journeys resonate long after the game ends.
The turn-based combat system is both accessible and strategic, with the materia system offering a vast array of customization options for each character. 
The world of Final Fantasy VII is expansive, filled with memorable locations, side quests, and secrets, encouraging exploration. 
The music, composed by Nobuo Uematsu, is iconic, with tracks like "One-Winged Angel" and "Aerith’s Theme" leaving a lasting impact.
Visually, though quite dated by today’s standards, the game’s pre-rendered backgrounds and character models have an undeniable charm that adds to its nostalgic allure. 
The pacing is near perfect, with a sense of adventure and tension that drives the story forward.
Final Fantasy VII is more than just a game; it’s an experience that redefined RPGs for a generation. 
Its influence on the industry is undeniable, and it continues to captivate players, old and new. 
If you haven’t played it yet, you’re missing out on a piece of gaming history.

185492997.review: Я отца этих создателей и фанатов этой игры на их маме делал. В заднее отверстие их делал. Я в эту игру 50 часов потратил чтобы на втором диске понять что я с самого начала эту игру неправильно играл. То какую-то фигню забыл, то что-то пропустил. Думаю: ну окей, сам допройду, потихоньку. А нет, хрен тебе. Если ты, говорит игра, не шаришь каждый пиксель на наличие какой-то малейшей фигни, то хрен тебе удовольствие. На тебе босса, который будет тебя в очко делать также, как я маму вашу, разрабы любимые, делал. Я устал. Я не хочу играть в этот ретро гейминг. 50 часов в никуда. 50 часов чтобы пропустить весь контент игры и застрять на одном боссе. 50 часов чтобы игра доказала мне что я неправ. Где я неправ. Я в игру хотел поиграть, ёмаё. Я без гайдов хотел поиграть, самому додуматься хотел. Нет, играй 50 часов и пойми, что там ты магилкиср потратил зря, и тут ты саммона пропустил, и там того босса секретного который только на секунду в очке мира появляется не зафайтил. Но ты конечно можешь всё исправить. Вот тебе 100 слотов для сохранения. Играй ещё 100 часов на здоровье. Или 200 часов. Или 1000 часов. Играй на здоровье, смотри на пиксели. Вот тебе пиксели Аерис, вот тебе Тифа, вот, на, дрочи. А ещё игру дрочи, фарми, фарми, фарми опыт. Это же одиночная игра с упором на сюжет и лор. Какая Дота, ты чего. 185471573.review:
Final Fantasy VII es mucho más que un juego. La música, compuesta por Nobuo Uematsu, se adapta perfectamente a cada situación, desde la épica batalla contra un jefe hasta los momentos más tranquilos y emotivos. Es de esas melodías que se quedan grabadas en la mente para siempre, evocando recuerdos de las aventuras en el mundo de Gaia.

Los personajes son el corazón de la historia. Cada uno tiene una personalidad única y un desarrollo que te hace sentir profundamente conectado con ellos. Aerith, mi maravillosa cetra y la diosa a la que siempre rezo, con su pureza y sacrificio. Tifa, mi increíble pelinegra de corazón fuerte y valiente, siempre protegiendo a los que ama. Yuffie, la soñadora y lianta que aporta un toque de humor y frescura. Vincent, mi amor eterno, con su misterioso y doloroso pasado. Red, mi adorable cachorrito que demuestra que el amor y la lealtad no tienen límites. Y, por supuesto, el recuerdo de Zack, un personaje que dejó una huella imborrable en mi corazón, cuyo sacrificio se convierte en una de las piedras angulares de la saga. No podemos olvidar a los villanos, con Sephiroth a la cabeza, uno de los antagonistas más carismáticos y complejos que existen.

La jugabilidad, con su sistema de combate por turnos, es clásica pero profunda, ideal para los amantes del género. Final Fantasy VII nunca decepciona en ese aspecto y sigue siendo un referente.

Y la historia… ah, la historia. Final Fantasy VII tiene la capacidad de tocarte el alma, con sus giros, su tragedia, pero también con sus momentos de esperanza. La lucha de Cloud por recordar su pasado, la conexión con sus amigos, la lucha contra el mal y la búsqueda de un propósito en medio de tanto caos, todo te llega al corazón y te hace reflexionar sobre la vida, el amor y la pérdida. Para mí, es y siempre será mi Final Fantasy favorito, (aunque Crisis Core tiene un lugar muy especial en mi corazón, especialmente por Zack y Genesis).

Es un juego que tengo en casi todas las plataformas, porque siempre quiero regresar a ese mundo, a esos personajes, a esa historia que nunca pierde su magia. Decir que lo recomiendo es quedarse corto, Final Fantasy VII es una obra maestra que todos deberían vivir al menos una vez en la vida.

You can report this toxic company to Steam by doing the following:

- Click on the "Square Enix" link to the right of "Publisher" at the top of the store page.
- Click the gear icon on the top-right. 
- Select "Report this company" and fill in the reason why (I suggest requesting Steam to halt business dealings with them).
- Click "Submit".

You can also choose to "Ignore" all their products from the same gear icon, which I also strongly suggest doing. Send a message to the gaming industry that this disgraceful behavior will not stand, nor go unpunished.

185340505.review: Very sad about Square being mean

185308084.review:
У відгуках на настільки класичні ігри завжди важко сказати щось нове. FInal Fantasy VII — одна з найбільш високооцінених, популярних та проданих ігор усіх часів. Але чи варто у неї грати саме зараз?

Відповідь — безперечно. Зараз ідеальний час для проходження Final Fantasy VII і ось чому.

З анонсом нової трилогії ремейків FF VII, підсерія фактично отримала друге дихання. І для максимального отримання кайфу, мурах, спітнілих долонь від "ремейків", необхідно пройти оригінал. Ремейки дуже хитро, вдало та з любов'ю видозмінюють сюжет гри, розширюють і доповнюють персонажів без висмоктування із пальця. І, що найголовніше, фактично нова трилогія не є ремейками. Фактично це ребілди, а за суттю — взагалі повноцінні сіквели. І щоб зрозуміти значущість нових сцен Remake/Rebirth, повний спектр їх епічності та розмаху, необхідний певний багаж знань, спогади про інший таймлайн, інший цикл Final Fantasy VII.

А кажучи про оригінал... Для мене гра стала дійсно шедевром, до якого у мене мінімум питань, які пов'язані переважно виключно з балансом деяких аспектів. Персонажі неймовірно приємні та колоритні, наратив епічний та з неймовірним розмахом та поворотами сюжету. Бойова система дійсно приносить кайф і постійно розвивається, але при цьому не можна сказати, що вона якась складна і ультра-тактична. Дуже багато міні-ігор, дуже багато позитивних вражень, дуже багато побічних активностей. Все це загалом озвучувалося усіма. 

Єдине, що може злякати деяких — це технічна застарілість гри, але хай цей аспект не стане вам перешкодою до проходження класики, яка у своєму серці залишилася молодою. У найгіршому випадку олд-непереносимості, ви можете поставити моди. Втім, я не можу не зазначити, що у оригінальної графіки є свій шарм. А ще музика шикарна, до речі.

А ще сквер енікс трохи обісрали все своїм лаунчером. У стімі немає облачних сейвів, вони на якихось серверах Сквейрів, і фактично облачні сейви на іншому компі не підтягувалися. Майте на увазі.

Маючи за спиною FF VII, я подивився половину трейлеру FF7 Rebirth, та в мене пішли мурахи від захвату. З такою силою я це відчував у останній раз, коли школярем чекав виходу Watch Dogs 1. Я у захопленні очікую виходу ПК-порту гри і не можу навіть уявити, як продовжать нову історію, як історії моїх улюблених персонажів ще сильніше поглиблять.

Якщо вам сподобався FF VII Remake, спробуйте пройти цю. Якщо ви не чіпали Final Fantasy, пройдіть цю. Якщо вам подобаються ігри з душею, які залишають усмішку після їх завершення, пройдіть Final Fantasy VII.

185304478.review:
From the lense of 2024, the game hasn't aged great. I found the controls pretty clunky and the older graphics made some buttons and world items you were supposed to click on quite hard to see. In 1997 they would look state of the art so I can't fault the game when I am playing it nearly 30 years later. A few of the minigames only explained what to do once and then threw you right into it leading to a lot of frustration because I didn't grasp what I was supposed to do. Was a fun running joke I said to friends that whenever I got stuck I was officially dumber than an 8 year old in 1997 who could figure it out back then. I even ended up having to write down some button translations since the game didn't display the playstation controller buttons. I had a crash 20 hours in that completely deleted my save file which was annoying, but besides that it ran pretty well. Despite this the world, map and animations of moves and attacks actually weren't half bad for a game so old. Much like FFX, it was cool summoning giant creatures to turn the tide of battle. 

When it came to combat, the game actually didn't show its age at all. FF7 features a turn based system, but with a timer that signified when you and enemies could take a turn. This means that while you are trying to figure out a plan of attack, the enemy can hit you. While I still prefer straight up turn based, I kind of loved that challenge. Having to think on your feet and be prepared meant that you could get punished for making mistakes more. Each team member could for the most part be built however you liked so there wasn't any real restrictions on who you had in your party unless you were doing a specific quest for one of them. The materia system allowed for sick combos and the balancing of those with how much hp and mp the character had led to some tough decisions and setups. 

The story of FF7 really shines and stands the test of time. It hits all the emotions and is well worth putting up with the really old gameplay. It brought a lot of challenges and really tested my patience at times, but I am really glad I played it. It has made me even more excited to see the story and characters in a modern light with the remakes and I now know what all the hype behind it was. I can completely understand why everyone lost their minds about it back when it came out and despite all its flaws I would still recommend it for jrpg enthusiasts.

185221914.review: Me había olvidado lo feo que es el pathfinding de este juego. Pero es muy bueno. RPG viejo, pero muy bien hecho. El argumento está bueno: una compañía logró conseguir una vasta fuente de energía capaz de alimentar todo mundo con electricidad. Pero lo que nadie sabe es que esa energía la están extrayendo directamente del planeta, es la energía vital del planeta. Y la central está en la ciudad de Midgar distribuida en 8 sectores con un enorme reactor cada uno que está matan el planeta poco a poco. Vos tenés que destruir todos los reactores para hacer que la compañía no pueda más secar la vida de toda la tierra. Pero va a pasar algo que sacude todo y eso es lo atrapante.

I never owned a PS1 but have always enjoyed the final fantasy games I have played (kinda randomly 1, 3, 10, 13, 14, 15 and a few spin offs by this point). I also knew how highly regarded this game was, and for years I've tried to get into it, and finally I decided to persevere this Christmas.

It has jank. It has aged. But once I got far enough into it, I was hooked in. I really enjoyed the story, and I can see why it's so lived by it's fans - I imagine this could be one of those RPGs I may revisit in the future (aside from now being sorry excited to play through the remakes!)

Just to add that I did use a couple of graphics mods - I feel like doing so made getting into the game that much easier.

185016603.review:
[h1]Negative[/h1]

PS4 version has:
• 3x speed
• Battlemode (invincible + limit break)
• Fun and challenging achievements

PC (steam) version has:
• Launcher that requires you to log into Square Enix. If you don't have a profile, you need to create one or you can't play this 20+ year old game.
• The character booster requires that you enable it through Square Enix page?
• No Steam Cloud save
• Basically different from the other FF releases and if you really want to enjoy the game, you would need mods which isn't something I usually do, but for this port, I'd say it's almost a necessity. 

• Not recommended

184980612.review:
The story is great, played it right around when rebirth was coming out so I would know how the original story went for when I actually play rebirth on PC soon.

I played this on the steam deck oled and it worked great on it after modding it.  Definitely use the 7th heaven mod manager (there is a version made specifically for Linux/steam os).  There is no way I would have to a rated playing this without graphical mods, the 60 fps gameplay mod and especially the echo-s7 mod.  I highly recommend the last mod as it gives voices to literally every single character and npc in the game plus it has auto text advance.

I actually did not care for the style of turn based gameplay this has as you don't know when exactly the enemy will attack.  I'd die use a true wait mode mod so it would behave more like a regular turned based game.

Overall I love the characters and again it was great to play on a handheld device after configuring all the mods correctly.  Play this first if you have never played the remake games yet (despite the janky this game has) as they are more than just a typical remake.  I won't spoil anything here but let's just say remake has a deeper meaning.

Very excited to dive in to rebirth in the coming weeks as long as it runs well.... Fingers crossed lol.

184962711.review:
Insanely bad port.

Gameplay-wise, as said on other reviews, the game has a lot of weird little things that make you wonder "Why would someone ever design their game like this", like cutscenes for taking a literal step, unskippable cutscenes, extremely frequent encounters with long and unskippable animations before and after each encounter.

The most annoying one to me is doors being on the same direction you face when you leave a room. Normally, if you leave a room from a door on the left wall in the game, on the outside, this door will now be on the right, which makes sense, since you left walking to the left. Not here, on this game the perspective of the camera will almost always change and the door will be on the left wall, the same direction you're facing, which means, if you hold your left directional, you'll keep entering and leaving the same room in a loop, so every time you leave or enter a room you have to let go of the directional and wait to see which direction you'll be facing on the next room before moving. 

Some of those little things can get a bit annoying relly fast, but that's just how old JRPGs are, i guess, so that's only a small part of the reason behind my negative review.

First, the game (a 10 years old port for a 30 years old single player game), requires you to create and log in to an external Square Enix account. The reason why is simply beyond me, but i don't like it.

Second, the game has occasional lag for a few seconds, which really shouldn't happen, given how low the requisites are.

Third, the controls do feel a bit janky sometimes and playing on controller limits some of your actions for some reason, for example, i can't skip (the skippable) cutscenes on controller, i have to reach to my keyboard to press enter. I don't understand why the confirm button on the controller couldn't do that. Sometimes it's also inconvenient to aim your attacks given how slippery/inconsistent the controls feel, and since there is a timer for attacks and you can get punished for not attacking fast enough, sometimes it's easier to just spam the confirm button and let your character launch whatever attack at whoever he wants to.

Lastly, and this is the most annoying problem i had by far. Pressing alt+tab freezes the entire game (It turns into a black screen) and makes you unable to minimize or close the game, forcing you to have a second monitor to open tab manager and force close the game or simply restart your PC. I had to reset my save like 4 times because i accidentaly pressed alt+tab to do things as minor as turning down the volume.

And those are just the problems i faced in under an hour of gameplay, so i can only imagine what would happen throughout a 60 to 70 hours long run. I do plan on trying to finish the game, but i can't help but point out those inconsistencies. The story might be good (i wouldn't know, since i haven't played much), but the port is definitely pretty ass.

184452056.review:
One of the best Final Fantasy games for sure. Didn't like it for the 7 unfinished playthroughs, but on that 8th playthrough (played on console, hence the low Steam playtime, currently on my 10th playthrough, my first with mods), I finally got into it, and I've loved it ever since. The materia system is so cool, the dungeons are fun, the story is fantastic, just a great game from start to finish. But honestly, the official translation sucks. It's poorly written, every dialogue feels stilted, it's good enough for you to get the story, but nothing more, honestly might be the worst official Final Fantasy translation. Even on a first playthrough, I recommend using the Shinra Archaeology Cut mod with the Vanilla preset. The mod itself restores a ton of cut content, but the Vanilla preset changes nothing but the translation to be closer to the original Japanese script (afaik), and it's better written in every way. Less typos, more natural dialogue, good stuff. Couple that with the 30fps battles mod and you're honestly good to go.

The 7th Heaven mod manager itself also has some neat features like anti-aliasing, resolution options, analogue control for 360 degree movement, realtime lighting, and a setting to change the color scheme of the game to simulate how it would look on official Japanese hardware at the time like the game was designed for, which looks a lot better imo.

The 100 million gil and mastering all of the materia feeling the most tedious with reaching Lvl 99 right after. That aside, I always love a good play through of FF7.

184366046.review:
I recommend FF7 itself; I do not recommend purchasing the PC version of this game. The game is incredible for its time, with phenomenal music, a beautiful world, captivating characters, and a riveting story. Some mechanics feel dated, and you 100% need a guide as some crucial items are easily missable, but it's an experience worth giving a try. However, the PC version of this game has instability issues which result in random crashes - and since this game has no autosave, that can mean losing lots of progress. Additionally, the cloud saving feature it boasts is done through Square Enix, which forces you to sign in with a Square Enix account in order to actually play the game. I think this means you can't play this version without an Internet connection, which is absurd given the game's older than Steam itself. Also, if the cloud saving feature fails for any reason, you can't even save locally, which at one point made me lose progress as well. I'd say about 15-20% of my playtime on Steam was having to replay sections due to these issues. This made minor annoyances (high random encounter rate, unskippable cutscenes, RNG on fleeing battles) turn into major frustrations. The breaking point for me was when I experienced a crash right as I was about to defeat the final boss! At that point, I gave up and used a save editor to breeze through the final gauntlet because I just didn't have the patience any more. 

If you want to play the original, either use an emulator (which comes with the benefit of savestates) or play the new console versions (which are more stable and come with QOL features like speed-up and disabling random encounters). The only good reason to play this version is if you'd like to indulge in mods, but otherwise, don't buy this.

183735533.review:
Great game (4/5) with a few flaws (and its not graphics nor age).
Strong points:
1. Storytelling and characters are superb. Cloud/protagonist does not fit traditional/cliche masculine frames, at best I can describe him as Don Quixote x Orpheus, he is very attractive and deep character as well as his companions, especially Tifa.
2. The level design is a cinematic work of art combining 3D figurines with prerendered landscapes. It does not look dated like one might say, it looks different. Blaming it for not being realistic is like blaming "Dark Crystal" for not being CGI. The game is not at all obsolete.
3. Game mechanics are essentially turn-based strategy with a time-limited decision making and diverse strategies provided by combining materia (spells) and equipment.
4. Soundtrack is a work of genius. It fits the locations and the events and worthy of listening of its own. 
Flaws:
1. UX is rather bad and UI is confusing and inefficient. Curiously it is not very different from original Pokemon for Gameboy.
2. You can get stuck quite a few times, having no clue how to move forward. If you value your time I recommend having a walk-through at hand.
3. Localisation is poor and quite a few in-game dialogs look rather awkward.
4. Like in many others Japanese RPGs, random battles with mobs can get quite irritating and tedious. - This is fixed for iOS but not for the Steam release.
5. The plot, however intriguing, has quite a few logical inconsistencies and abuses "deus ex machina." What is staggering is that, apparently, they made it even worse with the remake.

183568816.review: 对我来说绝对jrpg的集大成者，另外在b站有up做高清计划，值得一试。

183567236.review:
I remember the the 90's and this being one of the first RPG's I ever played. The intro haunts me still and sends shivers through me in how incredible it is whilst still being quite simple. It is a perfect game, without doubt! The story is rich, it is topical, the characters are likeable ( mostly ) and the world is engaging and changing.

To say they don't make em like they used to is an understatement with this game! And although it is not my favourite of the series, it will always hold a strong place in my heart.

Playing it in recent years is just as fun and if anything, i prefer them without voices as it allows the player to put more imagination on to them.
